Class Connect4Frame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      Connect4Frame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class Connect4Frame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

The main driver of the Connect4Game, as well as the visualization of it. You should not modify this class, and your agent should not need to access the methods within it directly.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

Connect4Frame

public Connect4Frame(Connect4Game game,
                     HAgent redPlayer,
                     Agent yellowPlayer)
Creates a new Connect4Frame with a given game and pair of players. Your agent will not need to use this method.

Parameters:
game - the game itself.
redPlayer - the agent playing as the red tokens.
yellowPlayer - the agent playing as the yellow tokens.

getLowestEmptyIndex

public int getLowestEmptyIndex(Connect4Column column)
Returns the index of the top empty slot in a particular column.

Parameters:
column - The column to check.
Returns:
the index of the top empty slot in a particular column; -1 if the column is already full.
